config.question: Why was the Soviet Union able to lay claim to the countries of eastern Europe and establish communist governments there?

choices.content: The Soviet Union had single-handedly driven Germany from the area.
The Allied Powers had promised this in exchange for Russian cooperation.
The Soviet Union had required the extra territory and resources to fight Japan.
The Allied Powers had concentrated on the conquest of the Pacific.

answer_3.response: Having borne the brunt of the fighting against Nazi Germany, Russia was ready to claim its reward—the postwar domination of eastern Europe.
